== Petliura ==
What does make Petliura to be nominated as a [[nationalist]]? The fact that he tried to reorganize the Ukrainian military by introducing the [[Ukrainian language]] cannot classify him as the nationalist or does it? Does promotion of the Ukrainian culture can classify one as a nationalist? Not necessarily. And finally, can the Soviet history's nomination of him as a nationalist be classified by the [[Encyclopedia Britannica]] (which already was called racial on several occasions) as one? Yes, why not. In fact there are no supporting evidence that clearly identify him as the nationalist. [[User:Aleksandr Grigoryev|Aleksandr Grigoryev]] ([[User talk:Aleksandr Grigoryev|talk]]) 02:06, 16 March 2010 (UTC) : [[WP:RS|Reliable sources]]. In this case, it's Peter Abbot's "Ukrainian Armies 1914-55", page 17. [http://books.google.com/books?id=F_QMCypjpXwC&pg=PA14 More] can be added, if you wish. Britannica is preferable in this case as it is a tertiary source, that is, an aggregation of secondary ones. --[[User:Illythr|Illythr]] ([[User talk:Illythr|talk]]) 16:47, 16 March 2010 (UTC)
== Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic military ==
Why is UkrSSR military involvement included here? First of all it was artificial country, second of all it did not have its military. Its military was headed by the Russian [[narkom]] [[Vladimir Antonov-Ovseyenko|Antonov-Ovseyenko]] who was assisted by the crazy [[Pavel Dybenko|Dybenko]] (supposedly Ukrainian, but he was born in the Russian-speaking uyezd of the [[Chernigov Governorate]]). The Red Cossack Division that participated in the Russian Civil war on the territory of Ukraine was recruited in the Don region. And the government of Ukraine consisted out of the Russian political party. There was not a single Ukrainian on that so called Soviet Ukrainian forces. [[User:Aleksandr Grigoryev|Aleksandr Grigoryev]] ([[User talk:Aleksandr Grigoryev|talk]]) 02:32, 16 March 2010 (UTC) : Because [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] say so. Specifically, the armistice was signed between the Poland, RSFSR and UkrSSR, marking them as participants in the war. --[[User:Illythr|Illythr]] ([[User talk:Illythr|talk]]) 16:47, 16 March 2010 (UTC)
== [[Polish-Soviet war]] == Please read the article, as well as [[Soviet Russia|this one]] and [http://books.google.com/books?q=%22Soviet-Polish+War%22+1920&btnG=Search+Books consult sources]. --[[User:Illythr|Illythr]] ([[User talk:Illythr|talk]]) 16:47, 16 March 2010 (UTC)
== Currently not GA class ==
I am seeing numerous unreferenced claims in the article. I do not believe it is up to the current GA class. --<sub style="border:1px solid #228B22;padding:1px;">[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User talk:Piotrus|<font style="color:#7CFC00;background:#006400;"> talk to me</font>]]</sub> 15:50, 3 June 2012 (UTC)
